name: Vegan Potato Kale Soup
description: This vegan potato kale soup does not only look really fancy, but it's also super delicious and packed with nutrients! Just perfect for Christmas!
recipeIngredient: 2,5 heaped cups potatoes, cut into small cubes
1/2 heaped cup carrots, chopped into small pieces
1/2 heaped cup celery (root), chopped into small pieces

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, heat some olive oil and sauté the onion for about 2 minutes. Then add the garlic and sauté for another minute.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pot, heat some olive oil and sauté the onion for about 2 minutes. Then add the garlic and sauté for another minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the potatoes, carrots, celery, and leek. Cook for 3 minutes. Then add the vegetable broth and cook for 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the potatoes, carrots, celery, and leek. Cook for 3 minutes. Then add the vegetable broth and cook for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime, make the homemade croutons. Cut the whole wheat toast into small cubes. Heat the vegan margarine in a small pan and roast the toast cubes for about 3 minutes until they're crispy and golden. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meantime, make the homemade croutons. Cut the whole wheat toast into small cubes. Heat the vegan margarine in a small pan and roast the toast cubes for about 3 minutes until they're crispy and golden. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: After the soup has cooked for about 15 minutes, add the kale and cook for another 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: After the soup has cooked for about 15 minutes, add the kale and cook for another 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Season with salt and pepper and blend until creamy. If you want the soup to be thinner, add some more vegetable broth.

recipeInstructions.text: Top the soup off with soy or oat cuisine and sprinkle it with roasted pumpkin seeds and homemade croutons.
